sentences.en: 'I thought we'd always been at war with Eurasia,'she said vaguely.
sentences.cn: “ 我还当我们一直跟欧亚国打仗哩, ” 她含含糊糊地说.
“ 我路过这里, ”温斯顿含糊地说.
“我不确定，”利兹含糊其词地说。
阿诺德感到有点儿尴尬。

sentences.en: He gestured vaguely towards the house.
sentences.cn: 他含混地指了指那房子.

sentences.en: He had a vaguely disreputable appearance.
sentences.cn: 他看上去有些不那么体面.

sentences.en: He had talked vaguely of going to work abroad.
sentences.cn: 他含糊其词地说了到国外工作的事.

sentences.en: He looked vaguely around the room as he spoke, his mind elsewhere.
sentences.cn: 他边说话边茫然地打量着房间，心不在焉的样子。

sentences.en: His statement was very vaguely worded.
sentences.cn: 他的声明措辞十分含糊。

sentences.en: I had been vaguely aware of a number of problems there.
sentences.cn: 我已经模模糊糊地觉察到那里存在的一系列问题.

sentences.en: Most farm workers were only vaguely aware that there was a storm on its way.
sentences.cn: 绝大多数农场工人只是隐约感觉到一场风暴将要来临。

sentences.en: She felt vaguely flattered at the suggestion.
sentences.cn: 她对这样的提议感觉有点受宠若惊.

sentences.en: The name sounded vaguely familiar to her.
sentences.cn: 这个名字她听上去有点熟悉.

sentences.en: The voice on the line was vaguely familiar, but Crook couldn't place it at first.
sentences.cn: 电话里的声音有点儿熟悉，但是克鲁克一开始想不起来到底是谁。

sentences.en: There was a sweetish smell, vaguely reminiscent of coffee.
sentences.cn: 有一股甜丝丝的气味, 使人隐隐觉得像是咖啡.

sentences.en: There was something vaguely familiar about him.
sentences.cn: 他身上有着某种似曾相识的东西。

words.tran_cn: 模糊的；含糊的；不明确的；暧昧的
